title: elianite
author: elianite
created_time: October 27, 2022, 10:28:00 AMLast edit: October 27, 2022, 12:59:55 PM by elianite
content: Taking offers on a full set of loaded 2011 BitBills in excellent condition.1 BTC, 5 BTC, 10 BTC, 20 BTC. Total load of 36 BTC (plus some dust sats).Provenance: PGP-verified message from Charlie Lee, saying he sold a set of BitBills to the current owner in 2019.Inquiries via PM, please. Located in Europe, transaction details to be discussed case-by-case.Info about BitBills can be found here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3334918.0

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: would it be possible for you to put some proofs online here from the legendary BitBill cards with your user and date ?

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: Quote from: tldr-hodl on October 27, 2022, 11:01:18 AMLol  I guess really no one is trusted here...Quote from: cygan on October 27, 2022, 10:31:17 AMwould it be possible for you to put some proofs online here from the legendary BitBill cards with your user and date ? you just want to be sure. i am not accusing anyone here of a scam but i have already fallen for it once here and would also like to protect the other interested users and myself from it.even the high rank of the seller has nothing to say...

comments.body: Quote from: cygan on October 27, 2022, 11:12:27 AMQuote from: tldr-hodl on October 27, 2022, 11:01:18 AMLol  I guess really no one is trusted here...Quote from: cygan on October 27, 2022, 10:31:17 AMwould it be possible for you to put some proofs online here from the legendary BitBill cards with your user and date ? you just want to be sure. i am not accusing anyone here of a scam but i have already fallen for it once here and would also like to protect the other interested users and myself from it.even the high rank of the seller has nothing to say...Well make sensse "dont trust - Verify!" always applicable

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: Yes but as a good starting point proof of ownership should be Â and has been established,so now any further negotiations can be build on that.Very interesting items from 2011 way out of my budget tho. unfortunately. GLWS

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: I cannot believe I'm seeing a full set on the forum right now. Truly amazing! I'd imagine this set would go for somewhere around 50 BTCCheers to whoever purchases this!

comments.author: FFrankie
comments.body: Quote from: tldr-hodl on October 27, 2022, 12:20:58 PM2 everyone - you're all right of course!!It's just that OP is Elias Ahonen, THE authority when it comes to these things (for those who don't know him); even his own encyclopedia is already a collectible itself.So I just found it a little bit funny, asking him for verification, that's all...Sorry 'bout dat ;-)its kinda like asking someone who is holding 500 btc of the fourms btc to post time stamped photos and the front and back of the cas coins they have for sale. kind of pointless

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: Quote from: FFrankie on October 27, 2022, 07:30:20 PMQuote from: tldr-hodl on October 27, 2022, 12:20:58 PM2 everyone - you're all right of course!!It's just that OP is Elias Ahonen, THE authority when it comes to these things (for those who don't know him); even his own encyclopedia is already a collectible itself.So I just found it a little bit funny, asking him for verification, that's all...Sorry 'bout dat ;-)its kinda like asking someone who is holding 500 btc of the fourms btc to post time stamped photos and the front and back of the cas coins they have for sale. kind of pointless it's not pointless at all. have you ever thought about the fact that these accounts can also be hacked ... but then the cry is then big when the dear Bitcoin are gone... has already happened to me here and I just want to warn you and show you what can happen just my 2 sats

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: Good luck with your sale EA! A set like this will only surface once in years, or maybe even decades. I agree with Cygan on verification and time stamping for safety and security. Status, or amount of BTC you hold, should not give you a pass for following forum ethics, rules, and protocols. Most of us who buy/sell/trade often have learned this the hard way by being burned. We want the physical cypto collectibles world to gain in popularity, and we always welcome new members. Some members may not even know who "THE" members are, nor do they give a shit. Just my two cents Â Quote from: cygan on October 27, 2022, 07:39:32 PMQuote from: FFrankie on October 27, 2022, 07:30:20 PMQuote from: tldr-hodl on October 27, 2022, 12:20:58 PM2 everyone - you're all right of course!!It's just that OP is Elias Ahonen, THE authority when it comes to these things (for those who don't know him); even his own encyclopedia is already a collectible itself.So I just found it a little bit funny, asking him for verification, that's all...Sorry 'bout dat ;-)its kinda like asking someone who is holding 500 btc of the fourms btc to post time stamped photos and the front and back of the cas coins they have for sale. kind of pointless it's not pointless at all. have you ever thought about the fact that these accounts can also be hacked ... but then the cry is then big when the dear Bitcoin are gone... has already happened to me here and I just want to warn you and show you what can happen just my 2 sats
